message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.DM, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with coding theory and information theory, specifically studying the parameters for which Reed-Muller codes can correct random erasures and errors with high probability. This falls under the sub-category of information theory (cs.IT). The paper also involves studying properties of evaluations of multi-variate polynomials, which is related to computational complexity (cs.CC) and discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The construction of a new code for error correction also involves studying subsets of coordinates, which is related to data structures (cs.DS). Finally, the paper involves obtaining bounds on the weight distribution of codes, which is related to statistical learning (cs.SI).
